application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T1. Horse Chestnut. 6 metres in height. Fell to ground level. Due to the removal of T1, a replacement tree must be planted between fences in the North East corner. T2. Twin Stemmed Ash Tree. 17 metres in height. Fell due to Inonotus present. Tree is declining in health. Situated between the fences to east of groundsman shed on northern boundary. Due to the removal of T2, a replacement tree must be planted between the fences to east of groundsman shed. T3. Oak Tree. 18 metres in height. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metres clearance. T4. Ash Tree. 9 metres in height. 2 metres in width. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metre clearance. T5. Red Oak Tree. 16 metres in heihgt. 4 metres in width. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metre clearance.T6. Maple Tree. 12 metres in height. 4 metres in width. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metre clearance.T7. Maple Tree. 12 metres in height. 4 metres in width. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metre clearance.T8. Ash Tree. 12 metres in height. 7 metres in width. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metre clearance. T9. Ash Tree. 12 metres in height. 6 metres in width. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metre clearance. T10. Ash Tree. 12 metres in height.. Remove deadwood present in crown and crown lift to achieve a 3 metre clearance.
